name: Mary STUTT, Appellant, v. John STUTT, III

judges: Before EAGEN, O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
JONES, C. J., took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.
parties: Mary STUTT, Appellant, v. John STUTT, III.

opinions.text:
OPINION OF THE COURT
PER CURIAM.
Decree affirmed. Appellant having been allowed to proceed in forma pauperis, there is no assessment of costs.
JONES, C. J., took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Andrew Mutch Knowlton, Philadelphia-, for appellant.
S. Stanton Miller, Jr., Media, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
354 A.2d 250
Mary STUTT, Appellant, v. John STUTT, III.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
April 7, 1976.
Andrew Mutch Knowlton, Philadelphia-, for appellant.
S. Stanton Miller, Jr., Media, for appellee.
Before EAGEN, O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
